news.title: Donald Trump warns Irish digital watchdogs to back off US tech giants as he threatens ‘substantial tariffs’
news.summary: Irish regulators that fine US tech firms could be targeted with visa restrictions, according to reports about US president Donald Trump’s latest trade threats.

news.title: Boy (11) thrown from car by hijacker while mother was in nearby shop
news.summary: An 11-year-old boy was thrown out of his mother’s car in a hijacking incident in north Dublin on Monday afternoon.

news.title: Mary Regan: Jim Gavin is the one with the army past, but is Billy Kelleher Fianna Fáil’s real action man?
news.summary: If former Dubs manager and army man Jim Gavin is the “school prefect” of presidential potentials, then Billy Kelleher, in the words of one Fianna Fáil TD, is “one of the lads, but the one who always has his homework done”.

news.title: Daniel McDonnell: Culling of Séamus Coleman indicates serious business starts now for Heimir Hallgrimsson
news.summary: The staging of Heimir Hallgrimsson’s squad announcement in the offices of Sky Ireland, the team’s sponsor, highlighted that his role requires an element of pressing the flesh and keeping up appearances.

news.title: Three children returned by US court to Ireland after father wins tug-of-love case
news.summary: A US court has directed the return of three young children to their father after their mother took them to Florida on a holiday last year and failed to return.

news.title: The Indo Daily: Richard Satchwell appeal: six grounds on which he is challenging his murder conviction
news.summary: In June, Richard Satchwell was sentenced to life for the murder of his wife, Tina - a conviction that brought relief to a grieving family, and closure to a community that had searched and waited for six long years.

news.title: What now after your Leaving Cert results? Here’s how to plan your next steps – whether you got top points or not
news.summary: The Leaving Certificate results have landed and for many of you in the Class of 2025, the weeks of anticipation, dread or hope have finally given way to the stark translation of those results into CAO points.

news.title: Ask a money coach: ‘I pick up the bill for my friends a lot, and I’m happy to, but I wish they weren’t so tight in return’
Pat McCarry: What trying to organise my 20-year J-1 reunion taught me about the realities of friendship in your 40s
news.summary: I did my J-1 in Chicago at a time the Cubs were still cursed by the Billy Goat, French fries were ‘freedom fries’, Tom Brady and Kobe Bryant were the new sporting icons, and La Résistance were the WWE’s biggest villains.

news.title: The Irish Independent’s View: World leaders are speaking out against Israel, but where are the actions to support their words?
news.summary: The smallest deed is said to be better than the mightiest of intentions. The truth of this is seen every day in the deepening torment of Gaza. The deaths multiply and lives are shattered as the war is stepped up.
